questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a group named Group1.

You need to ensure that only the members of Group1 can join devices to the Microsoft Entra tenant.

What should you configure in the Microsoft Entra admin center?

discussion.content: Correct: EntraID, Overview, Manage, Devices, Device Settings: Users may join devices to Microsoft Entra.

Option: A
You configure device join settings within the Device settings section of the Microsoft Entra admin center to control which users can join devices to Azure AD. Specifically, you'll find the setting "Users may join devices to Azure AD" which can be set to "All" (default), "Selected", or "None". 1 By selecting "Selected" and then adding Group1, you restrict device joins to only members of that group.

choices.A: authenticating to cloud resources by using single sign-on (SSO)

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Entra tenant named contoso.com that contains a Windows 11 device named Device1 and a user named User1.

User1 registers Device1 in contoso.com.

Which capability is available to Device1 after registering in contoso.com?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I'd say A, what capaibility is available so SSO is. The other options would need you to configure such policies which the question doesn't mention

Answer is correct: authenticating to cloud resources by using single sign-on (SSO)

After Device1 is registered in the Microsoft Entra tenant contoso.com, it gains several capabilities:
Single Sign-On (SSO): Device1 can use SSO to access cloud resources seamlessly.

Conditional Access: Device1 can be subject to Conditional Access policies, which help secure access to resources based on device compliance.

Mobile Device Management (MDM): If enrolled in MDM (e.g., Microsoft Intune), Device1 can have organization-required configurations enforced, such as password complexity and encryption.

Access to Organizational Resources: Device1 can access resources in the organization based on the Microsoft Entra account.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/devices/concept-device-registration
B should be my answer. A registered user/device can access company data when it meets compliancy and/or getting through ConditionalAccess. There is no SSO with such a registered device.

comments.content: You can't enforce compliance policies on registered devices, only enrolled devices

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains the devices shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to create two dynamic device groups named Group1 and Group2. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Group1 must contain Device1 and Device2 only.
• Group2 must contain Device1 and Device3 only.

Which device membership rule should you configure for each group? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
For me, there is no right answer for the second option:
•(device . deviceOSType -eq "iPhone") and (device . deviceOSType -eq "Windows"): There is no "iPhone" OS, and an AND means that both conditions must be true.
•(device . deviceOSType -eq "iPhone") or (device . deviceOSType -eq "Windows"): There is no "iPhone" OS, and this condition can also add device 2.
•(device . deviceTrustType -eq "AzureAD") or (device . deviceOSType -eq "iPhone": There is no "iPhone" OS, but this will be the correct one: AzureAD for Device1 OR iOS for Device3.

For Group1, last option is correct as mentioned in the above answer.
• (device.displayName -startsWith "Device") and (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows")

There is some kind of misprinting. For Group2 in all three options device.deviceOSType is set to iPhone which is invalid. I imagine the correct options will look like this:
• (device.deviceOSType -eq "iOS") and (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows")
• (device.deviceOSType -eq "iOS") or (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows")
• (device.deviceTrustType -eq "AzureAD") or (device.deviceOSType -eq "iOS")

comments.content: NB! Correct answer would be (device.deviceOSType -eq "iOS") and (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows") for group2

No, with an AND the group would need both conditions to be a member. 
With an OR, a device that is iOS or that is Windows, can be a member.

For Group2, last option is correct as mentioned in the above answer:
• (device.deviceTrustType -eq "AzureAD") or (device.deviceOSType -eq "iOS")

iPhone is not an OS type. iPhone Operating System is "IOS"
correct answer for group 2 is "(device.deviceOSType -eq "iPhone") or (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows")
actually, i take that back. I do not see the correct OSType for an iPhone in any of the given answers.

iPhone is not an OS type. iPhone Operating System is "IOS"
correct answer for group 2 is "(device.deviceOSType -eq "iPhone") or (device.deviceOSType -eq "Windows")
But wouldn't that include all 3 devices?

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to create a dynamic device group that will contain any device that has the word Marketing in its name.

Which device membership rule should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
• The -contains operator checks if a string includes a specific substring, regardless of whether the letters are uppercase or lowercase. For example, it would find "Marketing" in "Marketing Department", "marketing_team", and "Sales & Marketing".
• You’re looking for the substring "Marketing" (no wildcards needed). The -contains operator automatically checks if this string is part of the device name.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/users/groups-dynamic-membership

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to ensure that when a Windows device is joined to the Microsoft Entra tenant, the device is enrolled automatically in Microsoft Intune.

What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D looks correct
To ensure that a Windows device is enrolled automatically in Microsoft Intune when joined to the Microsoft Entra tenant, you need to:

Enable Windows automatic enrollment in the Microsoft Intune admin center.
Configure the MDM user scope to enable automatic MDM enrollment for Microsoft Entra users.
Use the default values for the relevant URLs.
For WIP user scope, select None.
Save the configuration

Answer is correct: the mobile device management (MDM) user scope

To configure Microsoft Intune mobile device management (MDM) enrollment settings so that corporate-owned and personal devices automatically enroll in Microsoft Intune you would use the MDM User scope. MDM user scope enables automatic enrollment for Microsoft Intune device management.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/quickstart-setup-auto-enrollment

choices.D: the mobile device management (MDM) user scope
choices.A: the Windows Information Protection (WIP) user scope
choices.C: the Microsoft Entra join and registration settings
